availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Neville M. Holeman (Hopkins Co., KY, farmer)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Hopkins County, Kentucky, native. Son of Ann Holeman. Married to Sarah W. Goodloe Holeman in Hopkins County, Kentucky, on September 7, 1858. Father of Lelia G. Holeman, Neville Holeman, and Henry Holeman. Student in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 420B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 600.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 209B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 172A-B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994039, Hopkins County Marriages, 1858.
"N. M. Holeman (1835-1906)," Find A Grave, Memorial #67484782 , accessed June 29, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67484782.
